prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Rayfa:
All members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks upon them.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

Person: Tahrust
Testimony 1
Testimony: My wife Beh'leeb was in the kitchen cooking the entire time.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 2
Testimony: When I listened to the tape later, I heard a man and a woman quarreling.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 3
Testimony: It sounded like an altercation between Acolyte Zeh'lot and Acolyte Fey.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 4
Testimony: After that, there was a loud noise, followed by haunting silence.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 5
Testimony: I would describe the noise as a terrible crash. Poor Zeh'lot... It must have felt so heavy.
Person: Tahrust

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to work through this step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and they want me to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The key here is to carefully read through each piece of evidence and testimony to spot any inconsistencies.

First, I'll start by looking at the testimonies. The testimony in question here is from Tahrust Inmee, the victim himself, but since he's deceased, this might be a recorded statement or something from before the incident. Testimony 3 says that the argument was between Acolyte Zeh'lot and Acolyte Fey. Wait, but looking at the characters, there's no one named Acolyte Fey. The characters listed include Maya Fey, who is a practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. So "Acolyte Fey" might refer to Maya, but her role isn't stated as an acolyte. However, that might not be a contradiction yet.

Looking at the evidences, Evidence 22 is a Family Photo taken during the Feast of Blessings the day before the rite. It shows Maya and the high priest's family. If Tahrust's testimony mentions an argument between Zeh'lot and Fey (Maya), but the family photo includes Maya, perhaps indicating her presence, that might not directly contradict. Wait, but the main point is to find a contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 3 mentions "Acolyte Fey" as part of the argument. But in the characters list, Maya Fey is described as a practitioner of the Kurain technique, not an acolyte. So if the term "Acolyte Fey" is used by Tahrust, but there's no evidence that Maya was an acolyte, that could be a contradiction. However, maybe "Acolyte" is just a title used there, but perhaps the evidence doesn't support that. Alternatively, maybe there's another contradiction.

Looking at Testimony 0: Tahrust says he was entertaining His Magistry and his family when the crime occurred. But if the crime happened during the Purification Rite, and the Rites Guide (Evidence 1) says the Rite of Fire ends with prayer until the rite concludes two days later at noon. However, the timing might not be conflicting here.

Another angle: Testimony 5 mentions a "terrible crash" that felt heavy, possibly implying Zeh'lot was hit by something heavy. Evidence 17's Autopsy Report states Zeh'lot died from a spinal injury from a blade. So the cause of death in the evidence is a stabbing, but the testimony describes a crash, which might suggest blunt force trauma. That's a contradiction between the cause of death described in the testimony versus the evidence. 

Wait, Testimony 5 says the noise was a "terrible crash" leading to Zeh'lot's death. But the Autopsy Report (Evidence17) says cause was a spinal injury from a bladed weapon. So the testimony's description of the death (crash) vs evidence's cause (stabbing) would contradict. That's a good point. So the testimony's account of the death's cause (crash) vs the evidence's autopsy (stabbing) would be conflicting. Therefore, the correct pair would be Evidence17 and Testimony5. 

Wait, but the user's previous examples sometimes had different numbering. Let me check the evidence numbers again. Evidence17 is Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report, and Testimony5 is Tahrust's statement. So the JSON would be {"evidence":17, "testimony":5}. That's the contradiction because the autopsy says he was stabbed, but the testimony describes a crash leading to his death.
</think>

Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Acolyte Fey channeled Lady Kee'ra's spirit.
Person: Tahrust

Person: Tahrust
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, it was the real Lady Kee'ra who returned to root out the rebels among us.
Person: Tahrust
Testimony 3
Testimony: She attacked and killed me with a strength far beyond any mortal woman.
Person: Tahrust

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony carefully.

First, looking at the testimonies provided by Tahrust (the high priest, who is the victim here). His testimony claims that Acolyte Fey (Maya) channeled Lady Kee'ra's spirit and killed him with supernatural strength. He also says that Lady Kee'ra returned to kill the rebels.

Now, let's check the evidences. The key here might be Evidence 23, the Tome of Secrets. It also mentions an image of the goddess holding a bird-shaped dagger. 

Additionally, Evidence 17 (Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report) states that his cause of death was a spinal injury from a bladed weapon. Evidence 18 is the Warbaa'd Dagger, which is associated with Lady Kee'ra. Now, Tahrust's testimony says he was killed by Lady Kee'ra's spirit with superhuman strength. However, the Tome of Secrets (Evidence 23) implies that only someone who knows the true name (Ihmsan) and has the dagger could impersonate Lady Kee'ra. Since Maya is a medium, maybe she didn't have the dagger or the knowledge. Alternatively, the autopsy report (Evidence 3) for Tahrust says he died from a bladed weapon, which could be the Warbaa'd Dagger. But if the testimony claims it was a spirit's strength, that contradicts the physical weapon used as per evidence.

Wait, Tahrust's testimony (Testimony 3) says he was killed by Lady Kee'ra's strength beyond mortal, but the Autopsy Report (Evidence3) says Tahrust's death was from a bladed weapon. So the testimony's supernatural cause contradicts the evidence showing a physical weapon was used. That's a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the Tome of Secrets being given to Beh'leeb (since she plays Lady Kee'ra) would mean only she knew the name, so Maya couldn't have done it. 

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says Tahrust was killed by Lady Kee'ra's spirit, but the Tome (Evidence23) says only the priestess (Beh'leeb) would have the Tome and the knowledge, so if Maya didn't have it, she couldn't have channeled properly. Hence, Tahrust's claim that Maya did it contradicts the Tome's requirement that only the chosen priestess (Beh'leeb) has the necessary knowledge. 

Wait, the Tome is given to the one playing Lady Kee'ra, which is Beh'leeb's role (as per her character description). So if Maya didn't have the Tome, she couldn't know the name, making it impossible for her to channel properly. Therefore, Tahrust's testimony that Maya did it via the spirit contradicts the Tome's requirement, which only Beh'leeb would have. 

Alternatively, maybe the key contradiction is between Testimony 3 (claiming supernatural cause) and the Autopsy Report (Evidence3) showing a bladed weapon caused Tahrust's death. The testimony's explanation doesn't align with the physical evidence of a weapon, suggesting a contradiction. 

I think the Autopsy Report (Evidence3) stating a bladed weapon caused Tahrust's death directly contradicts Tahrust's own testimony (Testimony3) that he was killed by Lady Kee'ra's supernatural strength. So the answer would be Evidence3 and Testimony3 (index 3 for testimony, since Testimony0 is the first, so Testimony3 is the fourth entry, which is the third index if starting at 0? Wait, need to check numbering.

Looking at the Testimonies section:

Testimony 0: "Acolyte Fey channeled..."
Testimony 1: "She is a spirit medium..."
Testimony 2: "So, it was the real Lady Kee'ra..."
Testimony 3: "She attacked and killed me..."

So Testimony 3 is the fourth entry (index 3). Evidence3 is Tahrust's Autopsy Report. So the contradiction is between Evidence3 and Testimony3. 

Alternatively, maybe another evidence. Let me double-check. The Tome of Secrets (Evidence23) says the priestess must know the name and have seen her face. If Maya didn't have the Tome, she couldn't know the name, so she couldn't channel properly. Tahrust's testimony claims she did, which would contradict Evidence23. But the problem is that the Tome is given only to the one playing Lady Kee'ra, which is Beh'leeb. So Maya wouldn't have it, making her unable to know the name, so Testimony0 (claiming she channeled) contradicts Evidence23. 

Hmm, which is the better contradiction? The Autopsy vs Testimony3 is a direct contradiction between weapon and supernatural cause. That seems more straightforward. So the answer would be {"evidence":3, "testimony":3}.
